info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 6:23PM CDT until March 30 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL HARDIN...NORTHEASTERN CRITTENDEN...SOUTHWESTERN UNION AND WEST CENTRAL WEBSTER COUNTIES... At 623 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Sturgis, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Hardin, northeastern Crittenden, southwestern Union and west central Webster Counties, including the following locations... Wheatcroft. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southern Illinois...and western and northwestern Kentucky. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
